plant.description: Herbaceous perennial plants and woody shrubs known for large, showy, often fragrant flowers. Commonly grown in gardens.

basics.description: Herbaceous perennial plants and woody shrubs known for large, showy, often fragrant flowers. Commonly grown in gardens.

toxins.name: Paeonol
toxins.description: A phenolic compound that causes gastrointestinal irritation.
toxins.concentration_notes: Concentrated mainly in the roots and bark.

treatments.name: Remove the Hazard and Contact the Vet: Immediately take the cat away from the plant and call your veterinarian for advice. Do not wait for severe symptoms to develop
Do Not Induce Vomiting: Do not attempt to make your cat sick at home unless explicitly instructed to do so by a professional, as it may not be helpful and can sometimes cause further harm
Collect Samples: If possible, take a sample of the plant—and a sample of the cat's vomit, if they have thrown up—to the veterinary clinic to help with the diagnosis
